response.answer_text: From a technical standpoint, yes. There have been many prototypes built. The emphasis these days are on ‘drone’ type with multiple propellers. Do you really want hundreds or thousands of flying cars all over the city, considering that some people can’t even drive properly?

Working flying cars have been a reality for almost a hundred years. Making a car that flies is possible but using it is not actually very convenient. Then safety becomes a major issue. That is why you don’t see them in use.

Helicopters have exsisted for a good while now. But they are not cheap for everyday use. Electric helicopter are starting to come out. A good bit cheaper, but limited range. Might be enough to get you to work, charge up there, and fly home.
No. They need airfields to fly to and from. Good luck getting one near home. Even better luck at your work.
